item.title: 中国淘宝网与创业公司合作，利用可重复使用火箭送货
item.description: 中国火箭制造商航天大纪元周日宣布，将与阿里巴巴旗下的在线购物平台淘宝网合作制造可重复使用的火箭，用于在一小时内送达全球的快递。【原文：Chinese rocket maker Space Epoch is working with Alibaba's online shopping platform Taobao to make reusable rockets for express deliveries that could arrive globally in an hour, Space Epoch announced on Sunday.】

item.title: 斯沃琪首席执行官称，中国买家对价格上涨犹豫不决
item.description: 瑞士钟表制造商斯沃琪集团首席执行官在接受一家报纸采访时说，由于消费者对价格上涨犹豫不决，中国市场在今年年底之前可能都会困难重重。【原文：The Chinese market is likely to be difficult until the end of the year with consumers hesitating over higher prices, the chief executive of Swiss watchmaker Swatch Group was quoted as saying in a newspaper interview.】

item.title: 日本小林制药公司第二家工厂因死亡事故接受检查
item.description: 一名官员说，在小林制药公司报告了可能与膳食补充剂有关的五起死亡事件后，卫生当局于周日搜查了该公司在日本西部的第二家工厂。【原文：Health authorities searched a second Kobayashi Pharmaceutical factory in western Japan on Sunday after the company reported five deaths possibly tied to dietary supplements, an official said.】

item.title: 中国 3 月份工厂活动六个月来首次出现扩张
item.description: 周日，一项官方工厂调查显示，3月份中国制造业活动出现六个月来的首次扩张，即使房地产行业的危机仍在拖累经济和信心，这也让政策制定者松了一口气。【原文：China's manufacturing activity expanded for the first time in six months in March, an official factory survey showed on Sunday, offering relief to policymakers even as a crisis in the property sector remains a drag on the economy and confidence.】

item.title: AT&T 称泄露的数据集影响约 7,300 万当前和以前的账户持有人
item.description: 电信公司 AT&T 周六表示，根据该公司对事件的初步分析，大约两周前在 "暗网 "上发布的一组数据影响了约 760 万当前账户持有人和 6540 万前账户持有人。【原文：Telecom company AT&T said on Saturday that a data set released on the "dark web" about two weeks ago has impacted approximately 7.6 million current account holders and 65.4 million former account holders, based on the company's preliminary analysis of the incident.】

item.title: 中国开发商万达以 83 亿美元出售 60% 的购物中心股份
item.description: 以私募股权公司 PAG 为首的一批投资者周六宣布投资 83 亿美元，收购中国房地产巨头大连万达购物中心部门 60% 的股份。【原文：A group of investors led by private equity firm PAG on Saturday announced an investment of $8.3 billion for a 60% stake in Chinese property giant Dalian Wanda's mall unit.】

item.title: 华为称奇瑞豪情 S7 高端电动车开始批量交付
item.description: 华为公司一位高管周六表示，在半导体短缺和生产问题导致生产和交付延迟之后，由中国科技巨头华为和奇瑞汽车联合开发的 Luxeed S7 电动轿车已开始批量交付。【原文：The Luxeed S7 electric sedan, developed by Chinese tech giant Huawei and Chery Auto, has started mass delivery after a shortage of semiconductors and production issues delayed production and delivery, a Huawei executive said on Saturday.】

item.title: 小林制药厂因可能与保健品有关的死亡事件被搜查
item.description: 一位官员说，日本卫生官员周六搜查了小林制药公司的一家工厂，因为该制药公司报告有五例死亡病例可能与使用红曲米的膳食补充剂有关。【原文：Japanese health officials searched a Kobayashi Pharmaceutical factory on Saturday after the drugmaker reported five deaths possibly linked to dietary supplements using red yeast rice, an official said.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州联邦法官阻止更新公平借贷规则
item.description: 德克萨斯州的一名联邦法官周五阻止了拜登政府期间通过的新法规的执行，该法规旨在全面改革贷款机构向中低收入美国人提供贷款和其他服务的方式。【原文：A federal judge in Texas on Friday blocked enforcement of new regulations adopted during the Biden administration that sought to overhaul how lenders extend loans and other services to low- and moderate-income Americans.】

item.title: 美国养老基金 CalPERS 在迪士尼董事会之争中投票支持佩尔茨和拉苏洛
item.description: 加州公务员退休系统（CalPERS）周五表示，美国养老基金已投票选举激进投资公司特里亚基金管理公司（Trian Fund Management）的两名董事候选人进入华特迪士尼公司董事会。【原文：The California Public Employees Retirement System (CalPERS) said on Friday the U.S. pension fund has voted to elect activist investment firm Trian Fund Management's two director candidates to the board of Walt Disney Co.】

item.title: 朝日新闻》：美日呼吁在人工智能和半导体领域深化合作
item.description: 朝日新闻》（Asahi Shimbun）周六称，日本首相岸田文雄（Fumio Kishida）下月与美国总统拜登（Joe Biden）会晤时，日美两国将在一份联合声明中宣布在人工智能（AI）等高科技领域开展更紧密的合作。【原文：Japan and the U.S. will announce closer cooperation in high-tech areas such as artificial intelligence (AI) in a joint statement when Prime Minister Fumio Kishida meets with President Joe Biden next month, the Asahi Shimbun newspaper said on Saturday.】

item.title: 官员称，美国将为部分经济适用房的租金上调设定上限
item.description: 一位政府高级官员周五表示，美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）的政府将很快宣布，联邦政府补贴的某些经济适用房单位的租金每年涨幅上限为 10%。【原文：U.S. President Joe Biden's administration will soon announce a 10% cap on yearly rent increases for certain affordable housing units that are subsidized by the federal government, a senior administration official said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国商务部更新对华人工智能芯片出口禁令
item.description: 拜登政府周五修订了实施五个月之久的规则，旨在使中国更难获取美国的人工智能芯片。【原文：The Biden administration on Friday revised five-month-old rules aimed at making it harder for China to access U.S. artificial intelligence chips.】

item.title: 美国上诉法院不会阻止联邦贸易委员会重审 Meta 隐私案
item.description: 美国上诉法院的一个合议庭周五驳回了 Meta 提出的在上诉期间阻止美国联邦贸易委员会重启对其 Facebook 部门调查的请求。【原文：A U.S. Court of Appeals panel on Friday rejected a request by Meta to block the U.S. Federal Trade Commission from reopening a probe into its Facebook unit pending appeal.】

item.title: 精神航空公司从 IAE 获得信贷，将增加流动性
item.description: 精神航空公司（Spirit Airlines）周五表示，该公司将每月从国际航空发动机公司（International Aero Engines）获得一笔信贷，直至 2024 年底，作为精神航空公司无法使用发动机出现问题的飞机的补偿。【原文：Spirit Airlines' said on Friday it will get a monthly credit from International Aero Engines through the end of 2024 as compensation for Spirit being unable to use aircraft with engine issues.】

item.title: 空客加拿大工厂生产率下滑，工人正在考虑新的合同方案
item.description: 据消息人士和工会周五发出的一份备忘录称，蒙特利尔地区的一家空客工厂正在加紧组装该公司最小的商用喷气机，工人们正在考虑新的合同报价，工厂的生产率有所下滑。【原文：Productivity has slipped at a Montreal-area Airbus factory trying to ramp up assembly of the planemaker's smallest commercial jet, as workers consider a new contract offer, according to sources and a union memo sent on Friday.】

item.title: 汽车制造商敦促白宫反对将美国钢铁公司出售给克里夫兰-克里夫斯公司
item.description: 代表主要汽车制造商的一个团体周五敦促白宫反对钢铁制造商克利夫兰-克里夫斯公司收购竞争对手美国钢铁公司的任何努力，并警告说，该交易可能导致汽车价格的反竞争。【原文：A group representing major automakers on Friday urged the White House to oppose any effort by steelmaker Cleveland-Cliffs to buy rival U.S. Steel , warning that a deal could result in anti-competitive pricing for vehicles.】

item.title: 据《信息报》报道，微软和 OpenAI 计划投资 1000 亿美元建设数据中心项目
item.description: 据 The Information 周五报道，微软和 OpenAI 正在规划一个耗资高达 1000 亿美元的数据中心项目，其中将包括一台名为 "星际之门 "的人工智能超级计算机。【原文：Microsoft and OpenAI are planning a data center project that could cost as much as $100 billion, and will include an artificial intelligence supercomputer called "Stargate", the Information reported on Friday.】

item.title: 2023 年，UAW 会员人数减少 3.3%，降至 37 万人
item.description: 根据周五提交给美国劳工部的一份报告，美国汽车工人联合会的会员人数在 2023 年下降了 3.3%，降至 37 万人，这是自 2009 年以来的最低水平。【原文：Membership in the United Auto Workers union fell 3.3% in 2023 to 370,000, its lowest level since 2009, according to a report filed on Friday with the U.S. Labor Department.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局认证湾流 G700 公务机
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（FAA）周五表示，已对通用动力公司（General Dynamics Corp）的湾流（Gulfstream）旗舰公务机 G700 进行了认证，从而推动了高端豪华喷气机市场的新一轮竞争。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) on Friday said it certified General Dynamics Corp's Gulfstream flagship G700 business aircraft, driving fresh competition in the top end of the market for luxury jets.】

item.title: 鲍威尔将更新政策观点，因为通胀依然胶着
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周五将更新他对美国通胀和经济的看法，此前公布的数据显示物价上涨速度超过了央行总裁上周的预期。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Friday will update his views on U.S. inflation and the economy following the release of data showing price increases running faster than the central bank chief last week anticipated.】

item.title: 智利科德尔科公司因产量下降导致 2023 年利润下滑
item.description: 智利铜业巨头 Codelco 公司（COBRE.UL）在周四提交的一份文件中称，该国有生产商 2023 年的毛利润为 31.2 亿美元，比上年下降了 34%，因为这家国有企业面临着运营和生产方面的挑战。【原文：Chilean copper giant Codelco (COBRE.UL) reported gross profit of $3.12 billion for 2023, the state-owned producer said in a filing on Thursday, a 34% dip from a year earlier after the state firm faced operational and production challenges.】

item.title: 美国敲定更严格的重型车辆尾气排放新限制标准
item.description: 美国环境保护局周五表示，它正在最终确定针对半挂卡车和公共汽车等重型车辆的严格的新尾气排放标准。【原文：The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency on Friday said it was finalizing stringent new tailpipe emissions standards for heavy duty vehicles like semi-trucks and buses.】

item.title: 美国 2 月通胀温和增长；消费支出激增
item.description: 美国 2 月份物价温和上涨，住房以外的服务成本大幅放缓，这使得美联储 6 月份降息的可能性继续存在。【原文：U.S. prices increased moderately in February and the cost of services outside housing slowed considerably, keeping a June interest rate cut from the Federal Reserve on the table.】

item.title: 在中国发布电动汽车，小米的 "雷神 "向埃隆-马斯克发起挑战
item.description: 他把小米从一家勉强起步的初创公司带成了以智能手机闻名的电子巨头，被称为中国的乔布斯。【原文：He was called China's answer to Steve Jobs for taking Xiaomi from scrappy startup to an electronics giant known for its smartphones.】

item.title: 马斯克的 Grok-1.5 人工智能聊天机器人将于下周上市
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的人工智能初创公司xAI最新推出的Grok-1.5聊天机器人将于下周在其社交媒体平台X上发布，这位亿万富翁周五在X上发表文章称。【原文：Elon Musk's artificial intelligence startup xAI's latest Grok-1.5 chatbot will be available on his social media platform X next week, the billionaire said in a post on X on Friday.】

item.title: 投资者将美联储降息和盈利视为维持市场涨势的关键
item.description: 在经历了今年股票市场的辉煌开局之后，投资者开始警惕第二季度可能出现的波动，因为他们要衡量美联储是否会在 6 月份实现降息预期，并将注意力转向即将到来的盈利状况。【原文：After a stellar start to the year for stocks, investors are on guard for potential bumps in the second quarter as they gauge whether the Federal Reserve delivers on an expected interest rate cut by June and turn their focus on the health of upcoming earnings.】

item.title: 美联储的平衡之道：即使通胀持续，6 月降息仍有戏
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示，尽管决策者的最新预测上调了今年的通胀前景，但央行并没有对更高的通胀率采取更宽容的态度，也没有触发更强硬的货币政策反应。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell says the central bank is not growing more tolerant of higher inflation even though the latest policymaker projections raised the inflation outlook for the year without triggering a tougher monetary-policy response.】

item.title: 美国就 K1 卡环变速器故障调查斯泰兰特 2022 RAM 卡车型号
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周五表示，美国缺陷调查办公室（ODI）已开始对克莱斯勒母公司斯特兰蒂斯公司 2022 年款 RAM 3500、4500 和 5500 卡车的 K1 卡环故障进行初步评估。【原文：The U.S. Office of Defect Investigations (ODI) has opened a preliminary evaluation of a failure of the K1 snap ring in Chrysler-parent Stellantis' year 2022 RAM 3500, 4500, and 5500 trucks, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Friday.】

item.title: 中国的红地毯吸引了众多首席执行官，但很少有人指望他们的资金会随之而来
item.description: 中国政府在本周专门为外国高管铺设了红地毯，试图阻止企业投资从这个曾被视为全球增长引擎的市场撤退。【原文：China's government devoted the week to a red carpet welcome for foreign executives to try to halt a retreat in corporate investment from a market once seen as the engine of global growth.】
